intro: Hieracium serratodentatum, commonly known as the serrated-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are deeply lobed and serrated, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, contributing to its role in pollination and ecological interactions.
